product_name: MACPro Longwear Paint Pot Cream Eyeshadow
summary: SummaryMAC Pro Longwear Paint Pot Eyeshadow is a highly pigmented, long-wearing, blendable cream eyeshadow that can be worn alone or as a primer with other products and lasts for 24 hours. MAC Pro Longwear Paint Pot Eyeshadow goes on creamy and dries to an intense, vibrant finish
details: DetailsBenefitsLong-wearing eyeshadow, 24 hoursNon-cakingNon-flakingNon-creasingWater-resistant formulaStay-true colorProvides flexible cream eyeshadow and/or primer coverageDoes not cause acneOphthalmologist-testedDermatologist-testedFeaturesInnovative second skin-like creamy eyeshadow formula blends smoothly over lidsCream eyeshadow creates seamless, buildable coverage without looking heavy or cakeyIts superior color purity stays true and will not streak or crease.Formulated WithoutGlutenPhthalateParabenVitamin A/Retinyl PalmitateMineral OilPetrolatumFormaldehydeHydroquinoneTriclosanCoal TarTolueneLauryl SulfateLaureth SulfateOxybenzoneItem 2510825How To UseSmooth eyeshadow over eye area with finger or brush.MAC Pro Longwear Paint Pot Cream Eyeshadow can be worn on its own or used as a primer with other products like MAC eyeshadows and eyeliners.IngredientsIsododecane, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Dimethicone, Polyethylene, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Quaternium-90 Bentonite, Dimethicone Silylate, Silica, Octyldodecanol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Lecithin, Trihydroxystearin, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax / Cera Carnauba / Cire De Carnauba, Propylene Carbonate, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Tin Oxide, Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate. May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Aluminum Powder (CI 77000), Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Blue 1 Lake (CI 42090), Bronze Powder (CI 77400), Carmine (CI 75470), Chromium Hydroxide Green (CI 77289), Chromium Oxide Greens (CI 77288), Ferric Ammonium Ferrocyanide (CI 77510), Ferric Ferrocyanide (CI 77510), Manganese Violet (CI 77742), Ultramarines (CI 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140).Please read the ingredient list on the packaging of your product to be sure that the ingredients are appropriate for your personal use.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Smooth eyeshadow over eye area with finger or brush.MAC Pro Longwear Paint Pot Cream Eyeshadow can be worn on its own or used as a primer with other products like MAC eyeshadows and eyeliners.
ingredients: Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax / Cera Carnauba / Cire De Carnauba
Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate. May Contain: Mica

reviews.headline: Yes, it's perfect. Love Painterly!
reviews.comments: I had been using some warmer toned eyeshadows and was really not enjoying them. I haven't figured out what my best colors are, but in the meantime, Painterly to the rescue! It's an excellent base and a shadow color that I'm feeling more comfortable with.

reviews.headline: Super amazing color for the pot cream
reviews.comments: First time purchasing the pot cream, and perfect for the makeup routine, and it creases for the eyelids to pop up for the color.

reviews.headline: love
reviews.comments: I'm in my mid 30s and am starting to have veiny eyelids. they've also always been oily and eyeshadow always creases. I've been on the hunt for something that evens out my lids and also stays put. I've tried other Mac paint pots but not painterly before now, I always thought it would be too pink on my skin tone (currently using ilia stick foundation 16N). the pinkish color is perfect for camouflaging the blue of the veins. I don't prefer the color by itself but it acts as a perfect primer for whatever powder I lay on top. I apply with an it cosmetics eyeshadow brush, a thin layer all over my lids. it's perfect for an easy, low maintenance everyday look for work!

reviews.headline: Painterly is Top Tier Eye Base
reviews.comments:
So, first and foremost: nothing will be 100% crease proof against 90 degree days in an arid state if you have oily eyelids. BUT, this on top of a primer and beneath my shadows, if I let it fully dry, will get me through a work day. I usually hit 5PM and I'm creasing, but this little guy does let me last until that 5:00 marker with my primer and shadows. I let it dry down and it works super well as a tacky base for my shadows to cling onto. 

I would recommend this in a shade close to your skin as a base or a primer for shadows if you have oily lids like me, hi hello. It works great. Not foolproof, but well worth the price in the hot weather with minimal touching up required to stop creasing or other wear.

reviews.headline: I will definitely purchase again and again such a great buy
reviews.comments: It serves as a high concealer also and hides dark sports too while being an eyeshadow

reviews.headline: Perfect eyeshadow base
reviews.comments: I have loved this for decades as an eyeshadow base, especially for a cut crease look. Highly recommended!

reviews.headline: I would definitely buy again
reviews.comments: Love these eye shadows…. Easy to apply, they stay put for the whole day (no creases) and easy to travel with (;not a liquid so can pack in carry on)

reviews.headline: I definitely will but again
reviews.comments: Second time I bought this item. Creamy texture rich selection of colors. Goes on smooth and lasts for a long time. No clumping.

reviews.headline: No grey!!
reviews.comments: Not one company not one, makes a light grey or cool purpish med grey without shimmer!! Why?   Ive looked for over 4 years!! Tons of creams and brown and mostly WARM SHADES. I have lyliterally looked at EVERY BRAND that makes cream shadow pots & sticks! NOTHING!!! So frustrating!

reviews.headline: No grey!!
reviews.comments: Not one company not one, makes a light grey or cool purpish med grey without shimmer!! Why?   Ive looked for over 4 years!! Tons of creams and brown and mostly WARM SHADES. I have lyliterally looked at EVERY BRAND that makes cream shadow pots & sticks! NOTHING!!! So frustrating!

reviews.headline: Pleasant Surprise
reviews.comments: I was looking to purchase eyelid primer and found it was no longer sold. A salesclerk recommended this product in the most neutral shade.  What I discovered is it is a great primer, but also that I can use it alone as a neutral eye shadow.  Also, I have sensitive skin and so far it has not caused any issue.

reviews.headline: New to this product. First impression good
reviews.comments: Need right applicator , and to get more familiar with it

reviews.headline: Always loved these paint pots
reviews.comments: I've been using the paint pots from MAC for over a decade.  They are terrific!  This color, Vintage Selection, is a perfect everyday light shimmer that makes getting ready so easy.  I don't love everything MAC makes, but the paint pots are a staple for me.

reviews.headline: I use this as an eye primer.
reviews.comments: The only thing that keeps my eyeliner in place.

reviews.headline: Used for years!
reviews.comments: I do not understand how this product doesn't have a full 5 stars. It is amazing and I have used it for years. I use as base shadow and it prevents all creasing. Amazing product!!

reviews.headline: Love love. Love
reviews.comments: The paint pot cream eyeshadow I use an eyelid primer and set it with loose powder and my eyeshadow and eyeliner stay on all day! Even if I sweat during my workout.

reviews.headline: Best eye primer out there
reviews.comments: I have eczema and therefore dry skin. Finding products that don't irritate my skin can ve difficult sometimes. When it comes to eyeshadow primer, I found my holy grail. It doesn't dry out my skin, it doesn't crease and the thing I love the most, is that blending my eyeshadow is just as easy as without any primer. This paint pot keeps your eyeshadow looking crisp the whole day (and night).

reviews.headline: Lasts a long time without creasing
reviews.comments: I have two other paint pots that work great for me, they go on smoothly and don't crease.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: Love this for priming my eyes for eyeshadow! It neutralizes the veins and discoloration in my eyelids nicely! It doesnt stay tacky tho like p louis it dries down so if you want the eyeshadow to stick to it work fast!

reviews.headline: Oldy but goody!
reviews.comments: Love this product!

faceoff_positive.comments: Originally I purchased this in Constructavist to be a strong base colour for my darker shadows and it worked beautifully. It wasn't till I tried the shade Painterly, however, that the product's full potential was revealed. I now use that shade as my only eyelid primer. It creates a smooth base that hides any unwanted pigmentation or imperfections and helps all eyeshadow stick and be more vibrant. It works better than other eyelid primers and even has a third effect as a under-eye concealer (not it's best function mind you, but in a pinch it gets the job done).
faceoff_positive.headline: Highly Versatile!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I purchased three of these a couple of weeks ago after having previously tried some colors. Overall here is the review of each color I have:
Painterly- Good basic eye base or for those days when you want bare but not red eyelids. It has no sparkle but doesn't give a matte dry look. Works well under other powder eyeshadow as it is a true neutral.
Constructivist- Great brown color that goes on beautifully with a finger tip and less so with a brush. This is the color that caused me to experiment with these things instead of powder eyeshadow. Good Brown, not red, not muddy. With sheen but not annoyingly sparkly
Vintage Selection- Kind of reminds me of All that Glitters; this paint pot has a sheer finish with gleam, not sparkles. I use this on its own, or as the base with a layer of anything else. I like this, the color is more Champagne, but not too pink or yellow- once again right in the middle.
Frozen Violet- While I like the color is is so sparkly someone that sees me everyday commented on it. The color is a medium, sheer plum, but once again, it has those sparkles that you cannot seem to get off your face everywhere you touch.
I ordered all of these (except the Constructivist- which I guess was limited series) off the MAC Pro website. So I did take a risk, but oh well. I would say NONE of the colors have a coverage that is like a matte- say Blanc Type, but if you are a natural girl they should work okay for you and of course you can layer. Just beware these do set fairly quickly. I find a fingertip application gives the nicest result. The synthetic brushes I have for some reason I hold on to the color and it applies unevenly.
Good Luck!
Also, I want to say I have been purchasing MAC since they first came to the US with Nordstrom (1989).
faceoff_negative.headline: Colors, texture coverage vary
